intro: Erythraea acutiflora, commonly known as the red-flowered erythraea, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking red tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a rough texture. Erythraea acutiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
